title: Brazil's Banco Bradesco to buy back 15 mln shares

content: SAO PAULO  April 30 Loan defaults in Brazil will remain stable throughout the year  with delinquencies among small- and mid-sized corporate borrowers staying elevated relative to other segments  Chief Executive Officer Luiz Carlos Angelotti said on Thursday.

title: Bradesco sees default ratio declining despite Brazil woes

content: SAO PAULO  April 29 Banco Bradesco SA  is prepared to deliver return on equity around 20 percent this year even if loan-loss provisions rise faster than loan book growth in the months ahead  Chief Financial Officer Luiz Carlos Angelotti said on Wednesday.

title: UPDATE 3-Bradesco sees ROE unscathed despite faster provision growth

content: SAO PAULO  April 29 A 0.5 percentage point jump in short-term loan delinquencies at Banco Bradesco SA in the first quarter was strictly due to seasonal factors  officials said on a conference call on Wednesday.

title: Surge in Bradesco short-term defaults was seasonal  official says

content: SAO PAULO  April 29 Banco Bradesco SA   Brazil's second-largest private-sector bank  slightly beat first-quarter earnings estimates on Wednesday after taking advantage of climbing interest rates to reprice new loans.

title: Brazil's Bradesco slightly beats first-quarter profit estimates

content: SAO PAULO  April 7 Banco Bradesco SA's investment-banking arm is confident that improved investor sentiment may unleash a flurry of local bond and stock offerings that murky market conditions have held back for months  a senior executive said on Tuesday.

title: Improving investor sentiment may spur Brazilian deals -Bradesco

content: SAO PAULO  April 6 A group of commercial banks and state-controlled oil producer Petróleo Brasileiro SA are close to extending loan refinancing to ailing oil rig producer Sete Brasil Participações SA  the top executive of Banco Bradesco SA said on Monday.
name: Banco Bradesco Sa
title: Sete Brasil close to obtaining loan relief  Bradesco CEO says

content: SAO PAULO  March 17 State-controlled Petróleo Brasileiro SA  hired several investment banks to help sell $13.7 billion worth of assets including gasoline stations  stakes in oil fields and electricity investments  Folha de S. Paulo reported on Monday.

title: Brazil's Petrobras hires banks to handle asset sales  Folha says
